intro: Hymenocrater argutidens, commonly known as the hairy hymenocrater, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries such as Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in open woodland or grassland habitats and is often found in disturbed soils. The plant's botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
